title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: Şah-i Zinde, Semerkant’ın ruhunu en derinden hissedebileceğiniz yerlerden biri. Her bir mozolenin çinileri, renkleri ve işçiliği adeta büyüleyici. Sessizliği ve atmosferiyle geçmişe bir yolculuk hissi veriyor. Mutlaka sabah erken saatlerde gitmenizi tavsiye ederim; kalabalık olmadan bu ihtişamı yaşamak bambaşka sizi uhrevi bir yolculuğa sürüklüyor.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Shah-i-Zinda necropolis is an absolute marvel! This stunning complex is a treasure trove of beautifully crafted mausoleums, each one more breathtaking than the last. As you step through the majestic gates, you're immediately struck by the kaleidoscope of blue tiles, majolica, and domes that seem to dance in the sunlight.

These are the unforgettable highlights for me.
Intricately Carved Wooden Doors
Each door is a masterpiece of craftsmanship, adorned with delicate patterns and designs.
Majestic Blue Domes
The vibrant blue hues seem to shimmer and glow, creating an otherworldly atmosphere.
Stunning Tile Work
The intricate tile work is simply awe-inspiring, with delicate floral patterns and geometric designs

Tips for Visitors
Visit early morning or late afternoon to avoid crowds and capture stunning photos.
Wear comfortable shoes and modest clothing.
Take your time to appreciate the intricate details and craftsmanship.

Rating
5/5 stars

Shah-i-Zinda necropolis is an absolute must-visit when in Samarkand. Be prepared to be awestruck by the beauty and grandeur of this incredible complex!

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis is a must visit site.  These are combination of Royal Mosoleums. Mosoleums for female royals are super beautiful. 3D glazed tiles, calligraphy & intricately carved wooden doors are just amazing.  Every building is beautiful.  I preferred to visit in the evening & it was awesome. Less people & more time to admire the beauty. Ticket is 50000 som about US$5. I suggest not to miss Shah-i-zinda necropolis.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Сказочный комплекс усыпальниц Шахи-Зинда.
Место захоронения царственных особ и знати. Основным мавзолеем считается могила двоюродного брата пророка Мухаммеда - Кусама ибн-Аббаса, при ней же малая мечеть.
Поражает цветовая гамма комплекса: голубой, синий, бирюза и, конечно, золотой. Майоликовые плитки, резная мозаика и арабская вязь тесно сплелись в единый сюжет. Каждое здание уникально.
Особенно прекрасны усыпальницы сестер Тамерлана: одинаковые по структуре, но совершенно разные по убранству и палитре

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: A visiter absolument à Samarcande. Enfilade de mausolées tous plus beaux les uns que les autres, intérieurs et surtout extérieurs, tous dans les tons bleus/verts. Tout est regroupé dans une même ruelle qui grimpe, on en prend plein les yeux pour seulement 50.000sums (bien moins cher que Gour Émir et Bibi khanum). Pas mal en fin de journée et après 18h lorsqu'ils éclairent, mais sans doute bien aussi le matin avec quelques jolis fronton tournés vers l'est. Par contre, peut-être éviter le week-end, car c'est un peu "étriqué" et lorsqu'il y a du monde, c'est vite saturé.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Orta Asya’daki en etkileyici türbe komplekslerinden biridir ve Özbekistan’ın Semerkant şehrinde yer alır. Burası, hem İslam mimarisi hem de Timur İmparatorluğu dönemi sanatı açısından büyük öneme sahiptir.

Adı: Şah-ı Zinde (Farsça: “Yaşayan Kral”)
•	Yapım Tarihi: 9. yüzyıldan başlayıp 14.–15. yüzyıllarda genişletilmiştir.
•	Önemi: Timurlular döneminin en görkemli anıt mezarlık komplekslerinden biridir.

“Şah-ı Zinde” ismi, İslamiyet’in Orta Asya’ya yayılmasında önemli rol oynayan Kusem bin Abbas’tan gelir.
•	Kusem bin Abbas, Hz. Muhammed’in kuzenidir.
•	Efsaneye göre Semerkant’ta İslam’ı yayarken şehit edilmiştir ama “ölmemiş, yeraltında yaşamaya devam etmektedir”. Bu yüzden buraya “Yaşayan Kral” anlamında Şah-ı Zinde adı verilmiştir.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Giving it 4 stars because the main attraction: Tomb of Quotham Ibn Abass is not visible. The patters and blue tiles are mesmerizing. Make sure to come here quite early because it could quickly become a bazzar and "best picture" race.
Entre fee is reasonable and there is a nice view of Bibi Khanum Mosque just up the stairs on the right. Most people miss it.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
2025年10月現在、入場料50,000sum
朝はクレカ使えましたが夜は使えないと言われ、スムがなかったのでドルでお願いして入れました
トイレは正面入り口を前にして右側に少し歩いたところにあります
夜に行きましたが鍵が閉まっていて、向いの駐車場にある管理人部屋のようなところにいた人が開けてくれました
(中が見えないので覗き込んだら出てきてくれました笑)

朝8時頃は某アジア人の団体客と思わしき人たちがいましたが、人は少なかったです
夜はもっと少なくほぼ貸切状態でした
日中もいいですが夜も素晴らしくて感動しました
入場料が安いのでぜひどっちも行ってほしいです
ウズベキスタンで一番行きたかった場所ですが、期待以上でした！

text:

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: A must visit when you’re in the city and I was blown away with the beauty. Fortunately it wasn’t too busy when I visited but I can imagine the crowds during peak season would be huge, so consider visiting early. You can easily pay by card to enter and the fee is small - only about £3 when I went. There’s lots of steps throughout the complex which can be tough in the heat, but it’s well worth it. Plenty of signs explain the different structures inside and there’s a couple of options to pick up a souvenir too if you want. A truly fantastic complex which you must visit if you’re in the city.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis

All'ingresso forniscono veli per coprire capelli e gambe, non fatevi truffare dai mercanti e guide della zona.

Also visit nearby Muslim and Jewish cemeteries.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Visiting Shah-i-Zinda (Shohi-Zinda Yodgorligi) which is one of Samarkand’s most remarkable sites, both historically and spiritually was amazing. This necropolis, dating back as early as the 9th century, is believed to house the grave of Qusam ibn Abbas, cousin of Prophet Muhammad, making it an important pilgrimage destination. The tilework and Timurid architecture are simply breathtaking, and walking through its narrow passageways feels like stepping into another era.

The entrance fee is 50,000 soms, and the ticket allows for multiple entries the same day, which is convenient if you want to return later. The site is still very much active for faithfuls, and there is ongoing restoration work to preserve its beauty. Dressing modestly is essential, men should cover below the knees, and women with open tops will need to cover up as well. Green Scarfs would be provided if you aren't dressed modestly.

For the best experience, visit early in the morning for a peaceful atmosphere or towards evening when the light makes the mosaics glow beautifully. Overall, it’s a fascinating blend of history, devotion, and artistry;definitely worth a visit if you’re in Samarkand.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis

Però se ci si perde un po’ tra le tombe vengono fuori foto particolari da angolazioni originali. Una volta dentro è molto bello. Sicuramente un must see di Samarcanda

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Un joyau de l’Ouzbékistan ✨
Découvrez le complexe funéraire de Shah-i-Zinda à Samarcande, un lieu d’une beauté époustouflante et d’une richesse historique et spirituelle unique.
Ce site, dont le nom signifie « le roi vivant », est un ensemble de mausolées et de tombes datant des IXe au XIXe siècles. Il s’est développé autour de la tombe supposée de Qutham ibn Abbas, un cousin et compagnon du prophète Mohammed (sws). L’histoire raconte qu’il est arrivé à Samarcande au VIIe siècle pour propager l’islam. Selon la légende, il ne serait pas mort mais aurait disparu dans une grotte profonde, d’où son surnom de « roi vivant ». Le complexe se distingue par ses mosaïques, ses céramiques et ses motifs islamiques finement travaillés, qui témoignent de l’art architectural timuride. Chaque mausolée raconte une histoire, rendant hommage à des membres de la famille royale de Amir Timur ou à des personnages importants de l’époque.
En 2001, ce lieu exceptionnel a été inscrit, avec la ville de Samarcande, sur la liste du patrimoine mondial de l’UNESCO. Cette reconnaissance a permis de préserver ce trésor historique pour les générations futures et de souligner son importance culturelle et architecturale au niveau mondial.
Visiter Shah-i-Zinda, c’est se plonger dans l’histoire, admirer l’art islamique et ressentir une ambiance de recueillement et de sérénité. C’est un incontournable si vous voyagez en Ouzbékistan !

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Semerkant’ın kalbinde, adeta göğe yükselen bir dua gibi uzanan Şah-ı Zinde bence Orta Asya’nın en büyüleyici yapılarından biri. Tarihi 9. yüzyıla kadar uzanıyor. Hz. Muhammed’in kuzeni Kusem bin Abbas’ın burada yattığına inanılıyor.

Kompleks mimari açıdan ise tam anlamıyla bir sanat eseri. Mozaiklerle bezeli türbeler, turkuaz çinilerin göz alıcı parıltısı ve her kapıda karşınıza çıkan ince işçilik insanı kendine hayran bırakıyor. Daracık avlulardan geçerken renklerin ve ışığın dansını izlemek, insana zamanda yolculuk yapıyormuş gibi bir his veriyor.

Burası sadece mimari bir şaheser değil; aynı zamanda ruhu besleyen bir mekân.  Özellikle akşamüstü güneşin ışıkları çinilere vurduğunda ortaya çıkan atmosfer tarifsiz. Semerkant’a yolunuz düşerse Şah-ı Zinde’yi mutlaka görün. Tarihin, sanatın ve maneviyatın iç içe geçtiği bu kutsal alanda kendinizi farklı bir âlemde hissedeceksiniz. Ben kendimi öyle hissettim.  ❤️❤️❤️

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Wow. What a beautiful, visually stunning place. Shah-i-Zinda is a place of cultural and religious significance. Unfortunately, like so many places, it is spoiled by a few people who do not know how to behave in such a place. It is not a place for a fashion shoot. Some of the guides are very disrespectful too. We were sitting in a small chapel near the top trying to have a silent prayer, when a guide came in with two people and immediately started his speech in a very loud voice. Genuinely don't understand this behaviour.
Please visit in respectful silence 🙏

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
ALERTA DE GOLPE E CORRUPÇÃO 🚨

Quando fizer o pagamento, exija o ticket. Principalmente para quem faz o pagamento por cartão bancário, o homem na bilheteria se recusa a dar o ticket e entrega apenas o comprovante do pagamento do cartão. Você pode ter problemas depois por não ter o ticket e ele desvia parte do dinheiro que deveria ir para a preservação do monumento. Havia policiais bem na frente do caixa, mas que parecem saber e aceitar a prática corrupta do homem na bilheteria. Insista e exija receber o seu ticket de entrada!

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
2025年8月入場料50000ソム（幼児無料）
クレジットカードOK
チケットはなし。
サマルカンドには沢山見所がありますが、選んで入場するならこちらはマスト！

肩や足が出ている服は入口でストール貸してもらえます（無料）

お手洗いは出入口近くにあり。
出入口は同じ場所。
階段があります、身軽がオススメ。

朝早く7:00くらいにくれば人が少なく写真が撮れます。団体ツアーが9:00には到着していました。

14〜15世紀にかけて次々と建てられた11の霊廟から成り立っており、「霊廟の通り」とも呼ばれています。王族や貴族の埋葬地で、特に預言者ムハンマドの従兄弟であるクサム・イブン・アッバスの霊廟が重要です。「シャヒ・ズィンダ」=ペルシャ語で「生ける王」を意味する名称で呼ばれています。彼はこの地でイスラム教を広めた人物の１人であり、後にこの場所は巡礼の重要な中心地として崇められるようになりました。

Пожалуй, одно из самых сказочных мест Самарканда.
Вход — 50 000 сум на человека (если правильно помню)

Оказавшись там, словно переносишься в восточную легенду: узкие улочки, яркие бирюзовые купола, мозаика и витиеватые узоры создают невероятную атмосферу. Кажется, будто всё это декорации к фильму, настолько красиво )

Днём туристов довольно много, но территория просторная, и место не выглядит перегруженным. Очень приятно просто гулять, рассматривать детали и ловить кадры 📸

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Şahi-Zinde Anıt KompleksiSemerkant hakkındaki efsanelerin çoğu ağarmış antik çağla ilgilidir, ancak şehrin gerçek tarihi daha da eskidir. Semerkant'ın ortaya çıkışı yaklaşık 2,5 bin yıl öncesine dayanmaktadır. Büyük Soğd şehri, daha sonra Maverannahr, Semerkant, bir çok devletin başkentiydi, bu güne kadar bu şehirde korunan mimari anıtlar, yukarıda belirtilenlerin kanıtıdır. Geçen tüm Hükümdarlar, diktikleri binalarla birbirlerini gölgede bırakmaya çalışmışlar ve bunun için büyük meblağlar harcamışlardır.

Modern Semerkant'ın kuzeydoğu kesiminin yakınında eski bir yerleşim yeri - Afrasiab bulunmaktadır. 13. yüzyıla kadar şehir Moğolların vahşi orduları tarafından yok edildi. Afrasiab'ın güney eteklerinde, büyük bir mezarlığın arasında, Semerkant'ın en iyi tarihi ve mimari topluluklarından biri var - "Şahi-Zinde" adlı bir türbe grubu bulunmaktadır.

Komplekse yaklaşırken Mezarlar zinciri, kentin ortaçağ savunma duvarının üzerine döküldüğü gibi mezara doğru sarkan yoldan görülebiliyor. "Şahi-Zinde" kompleksinin adı Farsça'dan "Yaşayan Padişah" olarak çevrilir ve Hz. Muhammed'in kuzeni, 7. yüzyılda Semerkant'a İslam'ı yaymak üzere Araplarla birlikte gelen Kusa-ibn-Abbas'ın sembolik mezarı ile ilişkilendirilir. Çok sayıda efsane, Kusam-ibn-Abbas'ın, namaz kılarken kafirlerin saldırısına uğrayarak inancı için acı çektiğini söyler.

En yaygın efsanelerden birine göre, mihraba (Mescit'te Mekke'nin yönünü gösteren niş) saklanmıştır, diğerlerine göre de, kendi kopmuş başını ellerinin arasına alarak yeraltı bahçesine götüren karanlık bir kuyuya atlamış ve bu güne kadar yaşamaya devam etmektedir. Kusam-ibn-Abbas türbesi kompleksin bir parçasıdır ve kuzeydoğu kesiminde yer almaktadır.Kompleks dokuz yüzyıl önce şekillenmeye başlamıştır. 11. yüzyılın ikinci yarısına kadar nekropolün bulunduğu bölge, ham tuğladan yapılmış konut binaları ile inşa edilmiş ve şehrin önemli bir nüfusunun yaşadığı bir alan idi. 11. yüzyılın sonunda, Afrasiab'ın güney eteklerinin bir kısmı terk edildi ve burada bir mezarlık ortaya çıkmaya başladı. Kusam-ibn-Abbas'ın mezarı buradaki en eski yapılardan biri olup, diğer zengin astarlı türbeler daha sonraki XI-XIII yüzyıllarına aittir.O uzak zamanlarda da, çevresindeki binalarla birlikte Kusam-ibn-Abbas'ın mezarı bir türbe olarak kabul edilmişti. 13. yüzyılda, Sahi-Zinde kompleksinin yapılarının çoğu Moğolların yenilgisinden sonra yıkıldı. Nekropolün canlanması XIV yüzyılda başlar. Burada dekoru ve tarzı ilk binaların dekorundan farklı olan yeni türbeler inşa ediliyor.Ancak en yoğun inşaat, Emir Timur döneminde gerçekleşmiştir. Bu dönemde Timur'un yakın akrabaları (kız kardeşleri, eşleri), ordusunun askeri soylularının temsilcileri, diğer dünyada şefaatini umarak, güzel türbelerini Kusam-ibn-Abbas'ın mezarının yanına diktiler. Bu dönemden kalma binaların çoğu günümüze kadar gelebilmiştir.Uluğ Bey devrinde büyük mimari ve planlama çalışmaları yapılmıştır. Bu sırada, alt giriş grubu inşa edilmiştir. Batı kısmında, Uluğ Bey zamanının astronomu Kazizade-Rumi'ye atfedilen iki kubbeli ince bir türbe inşa ediliyor.Şu anda, Şakhi-Zinde kompleksi 11 türbeden oluşmaktadır. Çoğu XIV yüzyıla aittir.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Айналада адам тым аз болды, сондықтан бүкіл кешенді бір тыныштықта аралап шықтық. Сол сәт ерекше әсер қалдырды — үнсіздік пен ескі қаланың рухы қатты сезілді.

Кесенелердің ішіне кіргенде уақыт артқа шегінгендей болды. Әр мозаика, әр қабырға — өз алдына тарих. Ал сахабаның жерленген жерін көргенде жүрек бір сәтке тоқтап қалғандай әсер етті. Сол заманды көзге елестетіп, іштей бір терең ойға баттым.

Бұл жер жай ғана архитектура емес, нағыз рухани кеңістік. Кешкі уақытта барғаныма өте қуаныштымын — тыныш, жан тынығарлық атмосфера болды.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Shah‑i‑Zinda, which means “The Living King,” is a mesmerizing necropolis nestled on the slopes of ancient Afrosiab, just outside historic Samarkand. Revered for its sacred heritage, the site is believed to house the tomb of Qutham ibn Abbas, a cousin of the Prophet Muhammad who came to preach Islam in the 7th century—a legacy that lent the site its name and spiritual power.

Spanning centuries of devotion, the complex evolved between the 11th and 19th centuries into a breathtaking ensemble of over twenty mausoleums, mosques, and ritual buildings. The most significant period of construction occurred in the 14th and 15th centuries under the Timurid dynasty, when elite family members such as Timur’s niece Shadi Mulk AKA, his sister Shirin Bika AKA, and the scholar Qadi Zade Rumi were interred in richly tile‑adorned tombs.

You enter through Ulugh Beg’s grand gateway and ascend a narrow, stepped alley flanked on both sides by mausoleums—each virtually a palace in miniature—crafted with vibrant turquoise, cobalt, and emerald tiles, rich calligraphy, and sculpted patterns. Despite a controversial restoration in the early 2000s, the dazzling aesthetics still evoke awe at every corner.

The complex is organized into three parts—lower, middle, and upper—with domed passageways called chartaks joining them. The upper section culminates in the sacred shrine of Qutham ibn Abbas, surrounded by mausoleums like those of Khodja Ahmad and Tuman Aka—Timur’s family members—and offers one of the most visually stunning views across the entire site.

Beyond its architectural beauty, Shah‑i‑Zinda remains a living site of pilgrimage and spiritual resonance. Visitors are expected to dress modestly and observe respectful behavior. Climbing its stone staircases is often accompanied by quiet prayers or wishes, offering a personal moment of reflection amid a sacred setting.

A stroll through Shah‑i‑Zinda is like walking through a living museum of Central Asian craftsmanship, faith, and art. Each mausoleum whispers a story—of dynastic pride, religious devotion, and architectural innovation. It’s an essential stop in Samarkand, offering a deeply moving blend of history and mysticism.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis

Невероятно красивое интересное место в Самарканде. Строения в основе 9-11 века, но основная часть уже 14-15 века. По своей сути это мавзолеи, большая часть династии Тимуридов.
Билет по состоянию на октябрь 2024 стоил 40000 сум., чуть меньше 400 рублей.
Лучше приходить к 7-8 утра есть возможность все рассмотреть без огромных толп туристов. Точнее совсем почти без людей и не по жаре.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: The Shah-i-Zinda is an ensemble of mousoleums dated as early as the 11th to 19th centuries. It is considered as one of Uzbekistan's most beautiful tiled necropolises and featured Timurid architecture unique to Central Asia. A must visit Unesco World Heritage Site for anyone visiting Samarkand.

text: Absolutely the most amazing place in Samarkand! The original well preserved tiling here is exceptional, as many of the buildings have minimal restoration. The restored work is also jaw dropping for its unique geometry and colors, and seeing where the restoration began in relation to preserved original facades offers a truly unique architectural and historical experience you seldom find. It strikes a perfect balance between preservation and restoration, to my mind.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: Il complesso di Shahi Zinda è uno dei monumenti più misteriosi ed unici di Samarcanda. Consiste in file di tombe dai colori blu vivaci raggruppate lungo i stretti vicoli medioevali. È un vero e proprio “cimitero di strada” composto da undici mausolei costruiti tra il XIV ed il XV secolo. Una bellezza unica unita ad un profondo significato spirituale e mistico. Sicuramente una delle tappe imprescindibili tra le cose da vedere a Samarcanda.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Dopo le tappe al Mausoleo di Tamerlano e all'Osservatorio di Uluğ Bek 🔭, la nostra prima mattinata di visita in città si è conclusa al complesso "Shah-i-Zinda" 🕌, importante sito funerario presso il quale sembrerebbe essere sepolto persino Kusam Ibn Abbas, cugino di Maometto. Si tratta di una magnifica necropoli composta da vari mausolei di epoche diverse che, senza ombra di dubbio, rappresenta uno dei luoghi più iconici di Samarcanda (dopo l'impareggiabile Registan è sicuramente l'attrazione che più ci ha colpiti durante il nostro tour cittadino). Per accedere al complesso bisogna varcare il grande portale d'accesso e salire la scalinata che conduce al sentiero di visita. Quest'ultimo si presenta come un lungo viale costeggiato ambo i lati dai vari mausolei che, in certi punti, sembrano quasi avvolgere il visitatore catapultandolo in un luogo senza tempo (notevoli la profondità e l'effetto prospettico d'insieme). Alla fine del percorso si giunge ad un'area cimiteriale caratterizzata, come sottolineato dalla nostra guida 👩, dalla presenza di lapidi 🪦 recanti anche i volti dei defunti (consuetudine che, a differenza di altre città uzbeke 🇺🇿, sembrerebbe essere particolarmente invlasa proprio a Samarcanda). Incantevoli poi i motivi stilistici delle singole strutture del complesso, dominati dai consueti abbinamenti cromatici 🔵⚪️🟡 dell'arte decorativa locale. All'interno di alcuni mausolei, in particolare quelli più in fondo, sono stati ricavati alcuni negozietti di souvenir e artigianato. La nostra visita è iniziata sulle 11.30 🕦 con una spiegazione introduttiva della guida 👩, la quale ci ha poi lasciato circa una mezz'ora per visitare in autonomia il complesso e scattare tutte le foto 📸 del caso (una effettivamente tirava l'altra). Sulle 12.30 🕧, infine, ci siamo ritrovati all'uscita per proseguire il nostro giro alla volta del Siyob Dehqon Bozori (il gran bazar cittadino). Visita imprescindibile e, dunque, senz'altro CONSIGLIATA 👍🏻.

P.S.❗️❗️❗️GOOGLE CENSURA❗️❗️❗️

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Shah-i-Zinda is one of Samarkand’s most breathtaking and sacred complexes—a place where history, spirituality, and artistry come together in perfect harmony. This “Living King” necropolis stretches along a narrow, ascending path flanked by some of the most exquisite tilework. The vivid blues, intricate floral patterns, and detailed calligraphy on the mausoleums are simply mesmerizing, each structure echoing the devotion and craftsmanship of a bygone era.

As you walk through its arched corridors, there’s a quiet reverence in the air—this is more than just architecture; it’s a sacred journey.
Whether you’re drawn by the beauty, the history, or the sense of peace it offers, Shah-i-Zinda leaves an unforgettable impression—an elegant testament to Samarkand’s timeless soul.

text:
Ticket Price: UZS 50,000 per person
This ticket is valid for one day only, and credit card payment is accepted at the entrance.
Shah-i-Zinda is home to stunningly beautiful mausoleums. Even though it’s a necropolis, the atmosphere is far from eerie. Instead, you’ll be captivated by the intricate artistry and rich history reflected in the tombs.
As one of the most popular attractions in Samarkand, it can get quite crowded. If you’d like to take photos without too many people around, I recommend visiting right when it opens — the early morning light and fewer visitors make for perfect photo opportunities.
If you’re interested in learning more about the history and the meanings behind the artwork on the tombs, consider hiring a local guide. They can provide fascinating insights that make the visit even more meaningful.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Join me on the final day of my Uzbekistan travel series as I explore the breathtaking Shah-i-Zinda in Samarkand — one of the most photogenic and spiritually significant landmarks in the country.  Shah-i-Zinda is more than a monument. It’s a time capsule — a walkable museum of faith, power, and art. As you approach the entrance of Shah-i-Zinda, you’ll climb the "Stairway to Paradise" — a long set of steps said to symbolically take you from this world into the next.👟 Wear good walking shoes — there are lots of stairs and uneven paths.

You’ll be greeted by a corridor of mausoleums — tiled in brilliant blues, turquoise, and gold. Each tomb is more beautiful than the last, showcasing Timurid artistry at its finest. The craftsmanship is unbelievable. Bring your wide-angle lens! The tight alleyways and tall arches make it tricky to capture the scale unless you're prepared.

Perfect spot for a traditional Uzbek costume photoshoot. Wearing white, blue, or bold colors helps you pop against the blue-tiled walls. If you’re traveling solo, you’ll find plenty of kind locals who’d be happy to take your photo.

There are several public transport stops nearby, making it convenient for those traveling to Shah-i-Zinda from remote parts of the city to arrive by bus or minibus. Payment for admission can be made in cash or with credit cards.

If you ever find yourself in Uzbekistan, make this your final stop to end your Samarkand itinerary, especially if you want to reflect on your journey or just unwind in a calm, beautiful space.
And that’s a wrap on my Uzbekistan travel series! If you’ve watched every episode — thank you very much.

티무르 왕조의 14-15세기 무덤군.

훌륭한 단일 건축도 종종 집합의 힘을 이기진 못 한다. 도시를 이룰 때 명작은 더 빛을 발하는 법이다.
사마르칸트에는 여러 훌륭한 유적들이 있지만 이곳이 제일 근사했다. 하나의 길(심지어 휘어진!)을 따라 여러 작은 건물들이 도시의 형상을 하고 있기 때문이다. 고만고만해 보이는 영묘들이 무리 안에서 보다 돋보이는 존재가 되기 위해 경쟁하는 모습이 건물 곳곳에 디테일로 보인다.

이곳은 죽은 자들의 도시가 아니다. 환생을 믿지 않는 시대의 무덤은 살아 있는 자들의 욕망이다. 덕분에 죽기 싫은 사람들의 마음이 도시 곳곳에 담겨 있다.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Shah-i Zinda is one of the oldest and most sacred necropolises in Samarkand, dating back to the 9th century. The name means "The Living King" and refers to the tomb of Qutham ibn Abbas, a cousin of the Prophet Muhammad, believed to be buried there. Over centuries, many nobles, scholars, and Timurid royals were also buried at the site. The complex is renowned for its exquisite tilework, mystical Arabic inscriptions, turquoise domes, and intricate mosaics. Each mausoleum is unique in design, making the entire ensemble a vibrant display of spiritual and architectural heritage.

Shohi Zinda — Samarqanddagi eng qadimiy va muqaddas maqbaralar majmuasi bo‘lib, u IX asrga borib taqaladi. Majmua “tirik sulton” degan ma’noni bildiradi va bu nom Islom payg‘ambari Muhammad s.a.v.ning amakivachchasi Qusam ibn Abbos qabrining shu yerda joylashgani bilan bog‘liq. Yillar davomida bu yerda ko‘plab mashhur amirlar, ulamolar va Temuriylar davri vakillari dafn etilgan. Majmua nafis koshinlar, sirli arabiy yozuvlar, moviy gumbazlar va mozaikalar bilan mashhur. Har bir maqbara o‘ziga xos uslubda bezatilgan bo‘lib, majmua boy ma’naviy va me’moriy merosni aks ettiradi.

Шахи-Зинда — один из древнейших и самых священных некрополей Самарканда, основанный в IX веке. Название переводится как «Живой царь» и связано с могилой Кусама ибн Аббаса, двоюродного брата пророка Мухаммада, который, как считается, похоронен здесь. В течение веков здесь также были погребены знатные люди, учёные и представители династии Тимуридов. Комплекс известен своими изысканными изразцами, мистическими арабскими надписями, бирюзовыми куполами и сложными мозаиками. Каждая усыпальница уникальна по своему оформлению, создавая яркое сочетание духовного и архитектурного наследия.

شاه زنده هو أحد أقدم وأقدس المجمعات الجنائزية في سمرقند، ويعود تاريخه إلى القرن التاسع الميلادي. يعني اسمه "الملك الحي"، ويُعتقد أنه يضم قبر قثم بن العباس، ابن عم النبي محمد ﷺ. دُفن في هذا المكان على مرّ القرون العديد من الأمراء والعلماء وشخصيات من عهد التيموريين. يتميّز المجمع ببلاطه الفاخر، والنقوش العربية الروحانية، والقباب الفيروزية، والفسيفساء المعقدة. كل ضريح يتمتع بطابع فريد، ما يجعل من المجمع عرضًا حيًا للإرث الروحي والمعماري.

Shah-i Zinda es una de las necrópolis más antiguas y sagradas de Samarcanda, que data del siglo IX. Su nombre significa "El Rey Viviente" y hace referencia a la tumba de Qutham ibn Abbas, primo del profeta Mahoma, quien se cree que está enterrado allí. A lo largo de los siglos, también fueron enterrados en este lugar nobles, sabios y miembros de la dinastía timúrida. El complejo es famoso por su cerámica delicada, inscripciones árabes místicas, cúpulas turquesas y mosaicos elaborados. Cada mausoleo tiene un diseño único, lo que convierte al conjunto en una expresión viva del patrimonio espiritual y arquitectónico.

沙希辛达陵墓群是撒马尔罕最古老、最神圣的陵园之一，可追溯到9世纪。“沙希辛达”意为“活着的国王”，指的是据说埋葬在此的先知穆罕默德的堂兄库萨姆·伊本·阿巴斯。几个世纪以来，许多贵族、学者和帖木儿王朝的成员也安葬于此。该建筑群以精美的瓷砖、神秘的阿拉伯铭文、青绿色圆顶和复杂的马赛克而著称。每座陵墓设计独特，整个陵园展现了丰富的精神与建筑遗产。

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Комплекс Шахи-Зинда в Самарканде произвел на меня неизгладимое впечатление!
Почему мне здесь так понравилось:
Атмосфера таинственности— узкая улочка между древними усыпальницами создаёт ощущение, будто ты попал в восточную сказку. Здесь какая-то особая энергетика — одновременно торжественная и умиротворяющая.
Архитектура красота😍
История на каждом шагу комплекс посвящён Кусаму ибн Аббасу, двоюродному брату пророка Мухаммеда. По легенде, он пришёл сюда проповедовать ислам и... остался живым («Шахи-Зинда» так и переводится — «Живой царь»).
Что особенно запомнилось:
- Вид сверху на голубые купола Самарканда — просто дух захватывает!
- Мавзолей Шади-Мульк-ака — один из самых красивых, с невероятной мозаикой.
- Местные гиды, которые с таким воодушевлением рассказывают легенды этого места.

Совет- Приходите сюда утром или на закате, когда туристов меньше, а солнце окрашивает мавзолеи в золотые тона. И не забудьте зарядить телефон — фотографировать захочется на каждом шагу)))
Шахи-Зинда — это must visit в Самарканде. Здесь действительно чувствуешь связь с вечностью. 10/10, однозначно рекомендую!

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: Magnificently unique! In 677, Qusam ibn Abbas, a first cousin of the prophet Mohammed, was killed in an attempt to conquer Samarkand in the name of Islam. According to legend, he was beheaded during prayer, but did not die. He descended via a well into the underworld where he lives on forever, which is why his tomb, an important place of pilgrimage for Muslims, is called Shah-i Zinda ("Living King"). In the 11th century, Qusam ibn Abbas was reburied on the edge of Afrosiab, the old Sogdian Marakanda (= Samarkand), in the mausoleum where he still lies today. Timur Lenk recognized the importance of the tomb of the "Living King" and had several mausoleums built here for family members and friends, which was the impetus for the creation of the unique and magnificent avenue of mausoleums that the Shah-i Zinda complex is today. Whoever climbs the holy steps after the Ulugh Beg Gate, and has passed the first chortoq (= open dome gate), ends up in a narrow street where all the colours of blue shine on the facades of the mausoleums. At the end of this avenue of mausoleums, on the right, is the beautiful tomb complex of Qusam ibn Abbas. Even if you do not come for a pilgrimage, the Shah-i Zinda complex is definitely worth a trip!

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Şah-ı Zinde adı, Hz. Muhammed’in kuzeni Kusam ibn Abbas’a (Kusam veya Qutham olarak da bilinir) dayanır. Efsaneye göre, 7. yüzyılda İslam’ı yaymak için Semerkant’a gelen Kusam, Zerdüşt ateşe tapanlar tarafından saldırıya uğramış veya başı kesilmiş, ancak mucizevi şekilde bir yarığa saklanarak veya bir kuyuda gizlenerek hayatta kalmıştır.
Yer altında bir cennette yaşadığına inanılır. Bu hikaye, İslam öncesi mitlerden uyarlanmış olabilir ve “Yaşayan Kral” adını doğurmuştur. Türbesindeki bir yazıt şöyledir: “Allah yolunda öldürülenler asla ölü sayılmaz. Hayır, onlar diridir.”

Mimari Yapı: Kompleks, 20’den fazla binadan oluşur ve 11 türbeyi içerir. Alt, orta ve üst olmak üzere üç gruba ayrılır, dört kemerli kubbeli geçitlerle (chartak) bağlanır. Afrasiab tepesinin güney yamacında 200 metrelik bir merdivenli yol boyunca uzanır, bu yüzden “Sokak Mezarlığı” olarak da anılır. Türbeler genellikle kare planlı, kubbeli ve portik girişli olup, sırlı terrakota, majolika çiniler ve oyma mozaiklerle süslenmiştir, Orta Asya ve İslam sanatını yansıtır.
- Önemli Türbeler:
- Şadi Mülk Aga Türbesi (1372): Timur’un yeğeni için yapılmış, olağanüstü terrakota işçiliği ve az restorasyonla dikkat çeker.
- Şirin Bika Aga Türbesi: Timur’un kız kardeşi için yapılmış, Şadi Mülk Aga’nın karşısında yer alır.
- Kusam ibn Abbas Türbesi: En kutsal ve en eski bölüm, 14.–15. yüzyıl yapılarından oluşan küçük bir kompleks.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Şehrin kuzeyinde Efrâsiyâb tepesi diye bilinen yükseltinin güney yamaçları mahallî çevrede kutsal bir mevki olarak kabul edilmiş, bu alanın önemi bölgede İslâmiyet’in yayıldığı tarihlerden başlayıp yüzyıllarca sürmüştür. Bunun sebebi, Hz. Peygamber’in amcasının oğlu Kusem b. Abbas’ın İslâm dinini yaymak üzere bölgeye gelerek burada şehid olmasıdır. Kusem b. Abbas için yapılan kabir zamanla önemli bir ziyaretgâh olmuş, etrafında türbeler ve mezarlık başta olmak üzere birçok yapı inşa edilmiştir. Kusem b. Abbas’ın kabri “Şâh-ı Zinde” (yaşayan sultan) diye anılmış ve bu adlandırma bütün alanı tanımlar hale gelmiştir.

The southern slopes of the hill known as Efrasiyab in the north of the city were considered a sacred place in the local environment, and the importance of this area began with the spread of Islam in the region and continued for centuries. The reason for this is that the Prophet's cousin, Qusem ibn Abbas, came to the region to spread the religion of Islam and was martyred here. The tomb built for Qusem ibn Abbas became an important place of pilgrimage over time, and many structures, including mausoleums and cemeteries, were built around it. The tomb of Qusem ibn Abbas was called "Shah-i Zinde" (living sultan) and this name came to define the entire area.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Шахи-Зинда в Самарканде — это место, где каждый шаг отзывается эхом веков, а бирюзовые купола кажутся кусочками неба, спустившимися на землю. Этот некрополь — не просто архитектурный ансамбль, а священное место, связанное с легендой о Кусаме ибн Аббасе, двоюродном брате пророка Мухаммеда. По преданию, он прибыл в Самарканд с миссией распространения ислама и был убит, но, вместо смерти, спустился в подземелье и продолжает жить, отсюда и название — «Живой царь» (Шахи-Зинда).
Ансамбль формировался с XI по XV века, и каждая гробница здесь — произведение искусства. Особенно впечатляют мозаики и майоликовые узоры мавзолеев династии Тимуридов. Невероятная палитра синих, бирюзовых и лазурных оттенков заставляет забыть о времени.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Shah-i-Zinda (Uzbek: Shohizinda; Persian: شاه زنده, meaning "The Living King") is one of the most iconic places to visit in Samarkhand. The complex consists of over 20 buildings and includes numerous historical mausoleums and other buildings dating back to the 11th century.

The mausoleum is particularly famous as it is the burial place of Qutham ibn Abbas, a cousin of Muhammad. He came to Samarkand with the Arab invasion in the 7th century to preach Islam.

Admission is 50,000 UZ som ($4 USD) for an ad
Outside there are souvenir shops, café, and parking is available. It is located very close to other historical sites, including Registan and 3 madrasahs (Beg Madrasah, Tilya-Kori Madrasah and Sher-Dor Madrasah), Bibi-Khanym Mosque, Bibi-Khanym mosoleum, Siyob bazar, and Gumbaz synagogue.

Definitely worth a visit! Five stars

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
撒马尔罕【夏伊·辛达陵墓群】
Shah-i-Zinda

夏伊辛达遗址群包括11 至 15 世纪和 19 世纪的陵墓和其他礼仪建筑。夏伊辛达（意为“永生的国王”）这个名字与穆罕默德的堂兄库萨姆·伊本·阿巴斯埋葬于此的传说有关。他在 7 世纪随阿拉伯入侵来到撒马尔罕传播伊斯兰教。
夏伊辛达建筑群历时八个世纪（从 11 世纪到 19 世纪）建成，目前包括二十多座建筑。

沿着一条 500 米左右长的大道修建了二十几座装饰着精美瓷砖的陵墓。这里围绕着 7 世纪的库萨姆·伊本·阿巴斯陵墓修建，穆罕默德的表亲，被人们称为“永生之王”夏伊·辛达。

地址：MX6Q+X5J, M-37, Samarkand
时间：7:00-22:00
门票：5w（30元）

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: Недалеко от мечети Биби-Ханум расположен один из самых загадочных и неповторимых архитектурных памятников Самарканда - комплекс Шахи-Зинда, состоящий из вереницы изящных, сверкающих голубыми красками усыпальниц. Гармонично сплетаясь в живую и подвижную композицию, разновременные мавзолеи тесно сгруппированы вдоль узкой средневековой улочки. Шахи-Зинда состоит из одиннадцати мавзолеев, которые были построены друг за другом в 14 - 15 веках.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Shohi Zinda majmuasi Samarqand shahrida joylashgan, O’rta Osiyo me’morchilik san’atining noyob yodgorliklaridan biri bo‘lib, diniy va tarixiy ahamiyati bilan dunyoga mashhurdir. Ushbu majmua 11–15-asrlar oralig‘ida qurilgan bo‘lib, unda islomiy din peshvolari, hukmdorlar va ularning qarindoshlari dafn etilgan.

Majmuaning nomi "Shohi Zinda" (tirik shoh) Hazrati Muhammad sollallohu alayhi vasallamning amakivachchasi Qusam ibn Abbosga bag‘ishlangan. Rivoyatlarga ko‘ra, u Islom dinini targ‘ib qilish uchun Samarqandga kelgan va bu yerda shahid bo‘lgan. Aytishlaricha, u mo‘jizaviy tarzda tirik qolgan va shu sababli majmua "Shohi Zinda" deb atalgan.

Majmuaning xususiyatlari:

1. Me’moriy uslubi: Shohi Zinda gumbazlari, fasadlari, koshinlari va naqshlari bilan o‘ziga xosdir. Ayniqsa, ko‘k, firuza va oqlangan rangdagi koshinlar me’moriy ansamblga husn qo‘shadi.

2. Tuzilishi: Majmua bir qancha maqbaralar, masjidlar va ichki yo‘laklardan iborat. U uch darajadagi zinapoyalar orqali bog‘langan va har bir bino turli xil bezaklar bilan ziynatlangan.

3. Tarixiy ahamiyati: Amir Temur va uning avlodlari tomonidan Shohi Zindaga ko‘p e’tibor qaratilgan. Ba’zi maqbaralar Amir Temur davrida barpo etilgan. Undagi yozuv va naqshlar Temuriylar davrining oliy darajadagi san’at yutug‘ini aks ettiradi.

4. Ruhiy ahamiyati: Shohi Zinda nafaqat tarixiy joy, balki muqaddas ziyoratgoh hamdir. Bu yerga musulmonlar ibodat uchun kelib, Hazrati Qusam ibn Abbos va boshqa dafn etilgan arboblarga hurmat bajo keltiradilar.

Shohi Zinda majmuasi nafaqat musulmon dunyosi, balki dunyo miqyosidagi noyob tarixiy me’moriy obidalardan biridir va har yili minglab turistlarni o‘ziga jalb etadi.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: Существует легенда о том, как свой 40-дневный молебен провёл в Шахи-Зинда и духовный глава самого многочисленного суфийского ордена накшбандия - Бахауддин Накшбанди. Ежедневно поминая Бога и поднимаясь ступенька за ступенькой по высокой Лестнице, вскоре он достиг ее верхней площадки. В тот же момент он увидел стремительно надвигающегося на него всадника на белой лошади. Мгновение и суфий думал, что его затопчет лошадь, но всадник, внимательно всматривающийся в лицо мастера, так же внезапно остановил лошадь и о чём-то спросил великого суфия.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
The necropolis of both the cousin of the Prophet Muhammed (peace be upon him) Kusam ibn Abbasand and the past royals and elite of Samarkands past.

This Necropolis is also viewed as an encyclopedia of Muslim architecture covering hundreds upon hundreds of years of styles and  patterns.

Igs mindblowingly beautiful. Don't miss it!

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: Qutham ibn al-ʿAbbās, approximately born in 624 in Medina and died in 677 in Samarkand, was an Arab statesman and preacher. He served as the leader of Mecca during the reign of Caliph Ali ibn Abi Talib and was one of the participants in the Arab Caliphate's conquest of Central Asia. In the name of Shah Zandan, one has to pay 40,000 Uzbek Som per person to go to Samarkand Uzbekistan.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Shah-i-Zinda in Samarkand is breathtakingly beautiful! As I walked amongst the stunning blue mosaics, I felt like I'd entered a different world. The intricate craftsmanship and serene atmosphere make it an unforgettable experience. A must-visit in Samarkand!

Since it is a Friday mosque too, visitors must be mindful of the timing they visit at as it is closed for visitors between 12 to 3 PM on Fridays.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: Shah-i-Zinda Necropolis is a captivating blend of art, history, and spirituality. This ancient burial site features a series of mausoleums with some of the most intricate tile work in Central Asia. Walking along the path feels sacred, as you admire the vivid blues and detailed carvings. It’s more than a monument; it’s a testament to the craftsmanship and devotion of past civilizations

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
"A Dream Come True: Exploring the Shahi Zinda Necropolis"
After years of it being on my bucket list, I finally had the chance to visit the stunning Shahi Zinda Necropolis in Samarkand. This architectural marvel, dating back to the 14th and 15th centuries, is a testament to the rich history and artistic brilliance of the Timurid era.
The complex is a visual feast, with its iconic blue and turquoise tiled mausoleums. Each building is a masterpiece of intricate tilework, calligraphy, and design. The level of preservation is truly remarkable, allowing visitors to appreciate the intricate details and craftsmanship of the eras gone by.
To fully immerse yourself in the experience, I strongly recommend visiting early in the morning to avoid crowds. A ticket is required for entry.
If you're planning a trip to Uzbekistan 🇺🇿, the Shahi Zinda Necropolis is an absolute must-visit. It's easily accessible from the city center by the Yandex cabs.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: One of the most beautiful historical spaces in the city, not to be missed. It's an ensemble of many tombs, mausoleums and mosques built back many centuries ago in the most beautiful and in the most ornate designs and artwork. Most of the buildings in the complex are located on top and you need to climb the stairs to reach it. Easily spend 1.5-2hrs here. Entry fee is UZS 40,000 (EUR3) for a foreigner

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Посетить стоит обязательно. Прикоснуться к многовековой истории и самобытной архитектуре Средней Азии. А колоритные переходы между мавзолеями - отличное место для фото (если удастся найти промежуток между волнами туристов).

Билет 65.000 сум (октябрь 2024г)

Добраться можно пешком (15 мин из центра города), либо на автобусе (№№ 12, 22, 30, 60, 66, 71, 93, 99, 256, М16), расписание и маршрут автобусов из разных частей города подробно указаны на яндекс-картах или 2Гис.

Шахи Зинда ("живой царь") - ансамбль мавзолеев с 25-вековой историей. К усыпальницам ведёт каменная лестница, и чтоб узнать, насколько ты грешен, нужно сосчитать ступени по пути наверх, и второй раз, спускаясь назад. Если число совпадёт, есть шанс попасть в рай.
Комплекс из 11 мавзолеев дополнялся новыми постройками вплоть до 19 века. Под царём подразумевается Кусам ибн Аббас - двоюродный брат пророка Мухаммеда. Над входом сохранилось панно с надписью: "Сказал пророк..., что Ал-Кусам-ибн-ал-Аббас больше всех людей похож на меня внешностью и характером".

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
샤히 진다(Shahi Zinda Elite Cemetery:Samarkand,Uz.)는
아프라샵 언덕 남쪽에 있는 푸른 색조로 장식된 독특한 중세 묘지입니다.
좁고 길쭉한 거리를 따라 11C~
15C까지 종교지도자,순교자,티무르 왕족의 영묘가 있습니다.
입구를 지나 계단을 올라가면 영묘들이 길게 줄지어 있는데
영묘마다 장식이 다양하고 아름다워 눈길을 사로잡으며 보는 방향에 따라 타일의 색채가 변한다.
맨 끝에는 쿠샨 이븐 압바스의 4단 영묘가 있는데 화려한 문양과 색채가 아름답다.
샤히진다 티켓 오피스 오른쪽으로 100m올라가면 공동 묘지로 갈 수 있는데(무료입장) 그 공동묘지 언덕 위에서 샤히진다를 내려다 볼수 있고 석양에 샤히진다가 물들면 황홀한 광경을 연출한다.이 때를 놓칠세라 인증 샷을 남기고 언덕을 내려온다.
샤히 진다 입장료는 30,000UZS.이며(촬영요금은 별도) Open 시간은 09~18시 까지입니다.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: 朝早く行くか午後日没を楽しむ時間帯で行くか。どっち時間帯でありまして、とても美しい風景が見れるジャスとなる+あろうとして夜も行くとライトアップはされませんけれども、電気がついていまして夜も階段が多い。美しい景色を楽しむ時間になります。朝早くお祈りするために行く人や、夜9時位のお祈りへ行く人もよくいらっしゃるので、巡礼者やものの人々にもいつでも空いてるところでございます。入り口から入る前に売店があるところにお手洗いも空いているので、いつでも体を清めることもお手洗いだけを利用するのもできます。ただし、観光客にしても女性の場合髪の毛を隠すスカーフぐらい持っていった方が中で小される前に必要かなと思います。ミニスカートの女性も中に用意してあります。布を渡されるので、それよりかはイスラム建築を回るときに、長袖やパンツも長い方が向こう側で後から言われるよりか良いと思います。

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Wow!
The necropolis of sha i Zinda is absolutely amazing with its vibrant turquoise-tiled mausoleums. It dates back to the 9th-14th centuries and is said to be the grave of  Qutham ibn Abbas. He was the Prophet Muhammad's cousin and is believed to have brought Islam to the Samarkand region. That's the reason why sha i zinda cis also called 'the mecca of Central Asia.'

text: The place itself was beautiful! Definitely a unique, historical place to visit. Our particular visit was ruined, however, by an amateur photographer. He decided that it was OK to set up a tripod in the middle of one building, telling other people to move out of his way to take pictures. He was moving around the signs that explained what each building meant as well. You'd think the security would do something about this, but noone did anything. The place could be better maintained to make sure that it remains an open, friendly place for anyone...

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
The Shah-i-Zinda Necropolis is a sacred and stunning complex of mausoleums adorned with exquisite tilework, dating back to the earliest days of Islam in Central Asia.
- **Construction Period:** 11th-15th centuries
- **Brief History:** The complex was developed over several centuries, with its most notable structures built during the Timurid period, as a burial site for royalty and nobility.
- The most important person traditionally believed to be buried at the Shah-i-Zinda Necropolis in Samarkand is Qusam ibn Abbas, a cousin of the Prophet Muhammad. Qusam ibn Abbas is revered as one of the earliest Islamic missionaries who brought Islam to the region of Central Asia. According to legend, he was martyred while spreading the Islamic faith in Samarkand, and his tomb at Shah-i-Zinda became a pilgrimage site, contributing to the necropolis's significance. The name "Shah-i-Zinda" translates to "The Living King," referring to Qusam ibn Abbas, whose spiritual presence is still venerated by many.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: Shakhi-Zinda é um complexo de mausoléus localizado em Samarcanda, Uzbequistão. Este local histórico, cujo nome significa "O Rei Vivo", é um importante centro de peregrinação muçulmana. O complexo é famoso por suas intricadas decorações de azulejos azuis e turquesa, refletindo a arte timúrida do século XIV. Entre os mausoléus, destaca-se o de Qusam ibn-Abbas, primo do Profeta Maomé, que, segundo a lenda, trouxe o Islã para a região. Shakhi-Zinda é considerado um exemplo excepcional da arquitetura islâmica na Ásia Central.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: Shah-i-Zinda is a sacred and stunning necropolis that left a profound impression on me. The complex of mausoleums, each with unique and intricate designs, is a testament to the artistry of the Timurid period. The vibrant blue tiles, detailed mosaics, and the peaceful atmosphere make it a place of reverence and beauty. Walking through the narrow alleyways and discovering the history of each mausoleum was a deeply moving experience. The panoramic view from the top is breathtaking, offering a glimpse into the past and the spiritual significance of this site. Shah-i-Zinda is a must-visit for anyone seeking to connect with the rich history and culture of Samarkand.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: ここを訪れる為にこの国に来たと言っても過言ではない。期待を上回る美しさに心が震え離れがたかった。どうしてこんなに美しい物を作れたのだろうか。沢山の異なる青、ターコイズグリーン。世界の名だたる美術館を訪れたが、それを上回るインパクト。絵画は忘れてしまうがここは忘れられない。長年の夢が叶った。敢えて画像は載せません。ご自身の目でぜひ訪れてください。営業開始時間7時と夕方から月が出るまでの時間を狙い滞在中2回訪れました。

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Semerkant'ın masalsı güzelliklerinden biri olan Şah-ı Zinde'yi ilk kez ziyaret ettiğimde, bu türbenin adeta büyülü bir atmosferi olduğuna tanık oldum. Orta Asya'nın tarihi ve kültürel mirasını en iyi yansıtan yerlerden biri olan bu kompleks, beni hem mimarisiyle hem de manevi huzuruyla etkiledi.

Sabahın erken saatlerinde Şah-ı Zinde'ye adım attığımda, serin bir rüzgarın tarihi taşlar arasından geçip beni karşıladığını hissettim. Türbe kompleksi, Rüstem Darvazası'ndan başlayan uzun bir merdivenle ziyaretçilere kapılarını açıyor. Merdivenleri tırmanırken, tarih boyunca buraya gelenlerin ayak izlerini takip ediyormuş gibi hissettim.

Komplekse girer girmez, çeşitli türbe ve mezarlarla dolu dar bir yol üzerinde ilerledim. Her biri farklı dönemlerde inşa edilmiş olan bu yapılar, mavi ve turkuaz çinilerle süslenmişti. Özellikle Şirin Bika Aka Türbesi'nin üzerindeki karmaşık geometrik desenler ve Kur'an ayetleri beni derinden etkiledi. Bu türbenin 14. yüzyılda inşa edildiğini ve Timur İmparatorluğu dönemine ait olduğunu öğrenmek, ziyaretimi daha da anlamlı kıldı.

Şah-ı Zinde'nin en dikkat çekici yapılarından biri olan Kusam İbn Abbas Türbesi, manevi atmosferiyle beni büyüledi. Rivayete göre, Peygamber Efendimizin (s.a.v.) amcasının oğlu olan Kusam İbn Abbas, İslam'ı Orta Asya'ya yayan ilk sahabelerden biriydi ve burada şehit düşmüştü. Türbenin içerisine girdiğimde, taş duvarlardan yayılan huzur ve sessizlik, zamanın durduğu bir an yaşattı bana.

Kompleksi gezerken, farklı dönemlere ait olan diğer yapıları da keşfetme fırsatım oldu. Her biri, hem mimari tarzı hem de tarihi önemleriyle dikkat çekiyordu. İslam sanatının zirvesini temsil eden bu yapıların her biri, tarih boyunca birçok kez restore edilmiş ve korunmuştu. Bu özenli çalışmalar, bugün bizlere geçmişin ihtişamını ve manevi değerlerini yaşatma fırsatı sunuyor.

Şah-ı Zinde'den ayrılırken, buranın sadece bir turistik mekan olmadığını, aynı zamanda manevi bir yolculuk ve tarih dersinin verildiği bir açık hava müzesi olduğunu fark ettim. Bu büyüleyici kompleksi ziyaret etme şansı bulduğum için kendimi şanslı hissediyorum ve bu deneyimi herkese tavsiye ediyorum. Şah-ı Zinde, Semerkant'ın kalbinde atmaya devam eden bir tarih ve inanç mirası olarak benim hafızamda daima özel bir yer tutacak.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: Tarihi ve mimarisiyle insanı içine çeken bir atmosferi mevcut. Alan komple bir nekropol içinde. Gezmesi çok keyifli. Yapılar sanki insanlarla konuşuyor birşeyler fısıldıyor gibi. Belirli dönemlerde yapılan türbeler mevcut. Rus döneminde fazlasıyla harap oluyor. Günümüzde restorasyon büyük ölçüde tamamlanmış. Giriş ücretli. Bu tarz yapıları gezerken insanlığın ortak mirası düşüncesinde gezersek muazzam bir keyif alınır.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
#羅素通絲路4 - #永生之墓

沙赫靜達陵墓群，在波斯語中是「永生之王」的意思。裡面由13座陵墓和一座清真寺組成，埋葬著穆罕默德的堂弟和撒爾馬罕的執政者家族們。

這邊感覺並不像是陵墓，反倒像是規劃整齊的社區。相較於金壁輝煌的帖木兒墓，我更喜歡這個美麗的藍色寂靜。

#Samarkand #Samarqand
#羅素通絲路 #羅素通西域 #西域
#烏茲別克 #uzbekistan

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: Piekne, obowiazkowe miejsce w Uzbekistanie. Wejście płatne. Można płacić kartą. Po wejściu 40 trudnych schodów pod górę.  Wewnatrz grobowce królów oraz grobowiec Qusama ibn Abbasa, kuzyna proroka Mahometa SAW, który wprowadził na terenach obecnego Uzbekistanu islam w VII wieku.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
사마르칸트에서 가장 좋았던 곳. 외국인 입장료는 40,000 숨으로, 현지인의 8배다. 우즈베키스탄에서는 볼거리나 물가에 비해 관광지의 입장료가 비싸다는 생각이 드는 곳이 많았다. 여기는 4,400원이 아깝지 않았다.

계단을 올라가고 나면 푸른 건물들이 가장 먼저 눈길을 사로잡는다. 이정도로 푸른 건물은, 우즈베키스탄에서 칼타 미노르 미나렛을 제외하고 본 적이 없다.

이슬람 건축을 잘 모르기에 부하라, 사마르칸트 등에서의 마드라사, 모스크가 다 똑같이 보인다고 생각할 때쯤 방문한, 굉장히 독특한 영묘다.

색감만 아름다운 것이 아니라, 새겨진 문양이나 캘리그라피 역시 섬세하다.

당일에 실수로 무릎이 보이는 반바지를 입었었는데, 입장 가능했다.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Kami berkunjung ke sana di hari jumat, merupakan salah satu situs populer di Samarkand Uzbekistan. Tempat ini adalah sebuah jalanan sekaligus komplek makam dengan dinding berlapis mozaik keramik yg cantik sekali.
Di bagian dalam terdapat ruangan² kamar yg sunyi senyap, yg di yakini sebagai makam Qusam ibn Abbas, sepupu nabi Muhammad SAW yg membawa Islam ke wilayah itu pada abad ke 7.
Saat kami ke sana, diingatkan untuk kaum wanita segera turun saat azan, krn ada mesjid di area tsb.
Sementara menunggu jemaah sholat, di sekitar area banyak toko² souvenir yg menjual kaos² dan cendera mata khas uzbekistan..bisa di tawar dan kualitasnya jg bagus, tersedia jg toilet yg bersih di area sekitar.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: Shah-i-Zinda is located on Aksaray Street in Samarkand, Uzbekistan, a convenient 30-minute walk from Registan Square. A Yandex taxi ride takes just 4 to 5 minutes and costs around 14,000 Uzbekistani som. Entrance to this UNESCO World Heritage Site is approximately 40,000 som per person. Known for its stunning Islamic architecture adorned with intricate blue tiles, Shah-i-Zinda features a series of mausoleums connected by stairs, offering a unique and historical journey into Central Asia's cultural heritage

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Шахи-Зинда стоит посетить. Это старейшие сооружения, датируются эпохой тюркской династии Караханидов (11-12вв).

Спокойное, обыденное место. Поднимаясь по лестнице, можно загадывать желание. Если при спуске счет совпадает - благостный знак.
Есть место для молитвы.

Людей было не так много, лучше посещать с утра.

В 2001 году ансамбль мавзолеев Шахи-Зинда вместе с другими древними постройками Самарканда включён в Список Всемирного наследия ЮНЕСКО.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
"Lăng Mộ Shah-i-Zinda: Hành Trình Thời Gian và Vẻ Đẹp Kiến Trúc Truyền Thống ở Samarkand, Uzbekistan
Lăng mộ Shah-i-Zinda, tọa lạc tại thành phố Samarkand, Uzbekistan, là một trong những di tích lịch sử và văn hóa quan trọng nhất của vùng Trung Á. Trải qua hàng thế kỷ, nơi này vẫn giữ được sự quyến rũ đầy mê hoặc, mời gọi du khách khám phá và ngưỡng mộ.

Lịch Sử và Ý Nghĩa
Lăng mộ Shah-i-Zinda, có nghĩa là ""Cảnh trời của Hoàng Tử Sống"", không chỉ là một nơi chôn cất mà còn là một biểu tượng của sự sống và trường tồn qua thời gian. Được xây dựng để tưởng nhớ người thân của người đạo Hồi Islam, nó đã trở thành một phần không thể tách rời của văn hóa Uzbekistan.

Kiến Trúc Độc Đáo
Lăng mộ Shah-i-Zinda là một tuyệt phẩm kiến trúc, nơi mà các kiến trúc sư và nghệ nhân đã để lại dấu ấn của họ qua từng tác phẩm. Mỗi công trình đều tỏa sáng với sự đa dạng về kiến trúc và trang trí, tạo nên một không gian thần bí và phong phú.

Cảm Nhận Cá Nhân
Bước chân vào khuôn viên của Shah-i-Zinda, tôi không thể không bị cuốn hút bởi vẻ đẹp cổ kính và nền văn hóa phong phú của nơi này. Những dãy lăng mộ huyền bí và những bức tượng đài tinh xảo khiến tôi nhớ mãi và để lại trong tâm trí những ấn tượng sâu sắc về một thời đại lịch sử đầy huyền bí.

Kết Luận
Lăng mộ Shah-i-Zinda không chỉ là một điểm tham quan văn hóa mà còn là một trải nghiệm tinh thần đầy ý nghĩa. Với sự kết hợp hài hòa giữa kiến trúc, lịch sử và cảm xúc, nơi này là một điểm dừng chân thú vị trong hành trình khám phá di sản của vùng Trung Á."

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: One of the most beautiful and sacred places in Samarkand. Usually crowded but it’s almost empty during early morning and after lunch if the weather is hot

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: Easy to reach and compact. 30 min walk from the  main tiurist area, but easily reached by cab. You can explore it within couple of hours. You do not need a tour guide since plaques are quite descriptive and free audio guide is available online

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: Beautiful architecture in the variety of ancient tombs and mausoleums. Rich sense of Samarkand's history. Very helpful staff on the premises. Recommend getting there earlier in the day.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: Es un inmenso cementerio de todas las épocas, en el que en una zona están los mausoleos más famosos. Vas por una calle que asciende y están a ambos lados, magníficos, con sus teselas y azulejos turquesas y sus interiores bellísimos. Lo mejor de Samarcanda

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: This stunning complex is a masterpiece of blue tiles and breathtaking designs that embody the quintessence of Islamic architecture. Each mausoleum offers something unique, with gorgeous mosaics and intricate carvings that left us awe-struck. It's not just beautiful—it's a place that truly captures the spirit and history of the Silk Road.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: One of the main historical sites in Samarkand. Of course, there are many others that are just as interesting, however, this is the one not to miss. Each building is similar on the outside and different on the inside. It felt like it had more meaning than other mausoleums and it was interesting to see how so many different people were buried here.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
شاه زنده (يعني "الملك الحي") هو مجمع مقابر ومبنى ديني في مدينة سمرقند، أوزبكستان.  يتكون هذا المجمع من 11 مقبرة تم بناؤها على التوالي خلال القرنين الرابع عشر والخامس عشر.  المقابر مغطاة بالبلاط الفيروزي أو الأزرق الداكن ومزينة بزخارف نباتية.

تاريخ:
شاه زنده هو مكان دفن عدد من الشخصيات المهمة في تاريخ سمرقند، بما في ذلك غاتسم بن عباس، ابن عم النبي محمد، وتيمور جوركاني، مؤسس الإمبراطورية التيمورية.

بنيان:

تعد الهندسة المعمارية لشاه زنده مثالاً بارزًا على العمارة التيمورية.  المقابر مغطاة بالبلاط الفيروزي والأزرق السماوي الذي يلمع في ضوء الشمس.  وزينت القباب والمآذن بزخارف هندسية ولزجة.

أهمية:
شاه زنده هي واحدة من أهم الأماكن الدينية والتاريخية في أوزبكستان.  تم تسجيل هذا المجمع كموقع للتراث العالمي لليونسكو في عام 1990

كتجربة.. كلها مقابر.. فاك الخيار من الذهاب إليه من عدمه

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: Снизила оценку из-за толпы людей, прогулка превращается в маневры, чтобы обойти-зайти хоть куда-то. Но место очень красивое, сама улочка между мавзолеями будто переносит в прошлое, мозаика впечатляет ✨ Возможно, нужно посещать очень рано, либо ближе к закрытию.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: It's massive cemetery complex hosting several tombs of generals,wives and other important personalities of Temur kingdom. Depending on how rich and famous you are, there are several tomb structures of domes on square,rectangular and octagonal bases with interiors having the luxury of paintings, leafy inscriptions and for some It's empty.There's one simple double dome mosque and other being big and colorful with several prayer halls and 14th century door inscriptions and entrance ticket for foreigners is 40000 som as of May 22nd.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: Visitare questo mausoleo sia al mattino che nel pomeriggio perchè la luce cambia i colori e l'aspetto dei mausolei e delle maioliche azzurre. Ammirare i dettagli dei mosaici nella parte bassa degli edifici: sono stupendi.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
You must visit this place! Please, do not leave it out from your Samarkand visit. I think I paid around 50k som entrance which is like 4 euro, and it is very worth it. It is a complex with different small mausoleums, all in beautiful blue and white tiles.

Make sure to check some of them from inside because they are even more mesmerizing. In the end of the complex there is the place where it is believed that a cousin of Mohammed lost his life. My friend said it can be considered as a pilgrimage place for believers. Very beautiful!

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: Shahizinda ist die bekannteste Nekropole in Zentralasien. Errichtet wurde diese Gräberstatt vom 9. Bis 19. Jhd. Ab dem 14. Jhd. Wurden die Adeligen der Timuriden hier bestattet. Die über 20 Mausoleen sind reich ausgestattet und von fantastischer Architektur und Mosaike. Wir waren tief beeindruckt.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: We just walked Samarkand because there are historic monuments everywhere. The Shakhi Zinda is the burial place of royal persons and nobles. It is indeed a complex of tombs and mausoluems and who is buried there becomes a bit mysterious at time. For example it is said that the main mausoleum from which the necropolis starts seems to be the imaginary grave of Prophet Muhammad's cousin, Kusam ibn Abbas. The complex was called "Shakhi Zinda" that means in Persian "The Living King". Its a bit hard to find an imaginary grave but the complex is quite compelling.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Ein unfassbar schöner Gedenkkomplex.
Die Kunst ist so wundervoll, man kann nicht genug davon haben. Die Mauern, Türen, Kuppeln; alles ist einzigartig.

Hier sind sehr viele Gräber, einer der wichtigsten Persönlichkeiten ist Kusam ibn Abbas (ra) - der Cousin des Propheten Muhammed (sav).

Leider ist hier immer soooo viel los, dass man keine schönen Videos aufnehmen kann.

Hier gibt es auch viele kleine Läden, die Souvenir verkaufen - natürlich für sehr teuer.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: La necropoli dei reali e dei nobili. Sono rimasta incantata da Shah-i-Zinda, per me è stata tra le attrazioni piú suggestive di tutta la vacanza. Resterete storditi dai mosaici di pietra blu e turchese e (purtroppo) anche dai numerosi turisti e pseudo-fashion blogger! Piccolo consiglio: andate la mattina presto e, se possibile, non il sabato o la domenica, noi non avevamo scelta.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: Shohi Zinda majmuasi Islom olamida muqaddas joylardan biri hisoblanadi. Chunki bu yerda Muhammad sallolohu alayhi vassalamga qarindosh zot Qusam ibn Abbos dafn qilingan. Shuningdek, bu yerda Temuriylar saltanatining ko'plab a'zolari, olimlar, buyuk binokorlar, zodagonlar dafn qilingani bilan tarixiy ahamiyati yanada ortadi. Me'moriy joziba, me'moriy yechimlar haqida gap bo'lishi mumkin emas. Yaxshisi kelib ko'rgan yaxshi.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Shah I zinda of Taskent is the most fascinating and overwhelming mausoleum I have ever experienced. It's surrounded by graveyard from 3 sides. The place is the assemblage of the royal graveyard, but the most significant one is the grave of the Cousin of the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH).
This is not just a graveyard but also a place of worship for the Muslims.
I explored the surrounding graveyard in the high ground to enjoy the beauty of the monuments. It was very amazing.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: Исторический комплекс 11 мавзолеев Караханидской и Тимуридской знати XIV—XV веков. Ступенчатая улица с подъемом. Основной мазолей двоюродного брата пророка Мухаммеда - Кусама ибн-Аббаса. Его так и называли «Шахи Зинда», что в переводе с персидского означает «Живой Царь». Он был одним из тех, кто проповедовал ислам в этом крае.

In Shahi Zinda—mausoleum buried cousin of prophet Mohammad sallallahu 'alayhi wa sallam, (Peace be upon him)  KUSAM IBN ABBAS

He was one of the first missionaries of Islamic religion in Central Asia and

was cousin and close associate of the prophet Muhammad S.A.V Peace be upon him.

Prophet Muhammad S.A.V Peace be upon him said,
"Kusam Ibn Abbas is more than any other person looks like me by character and appearance"

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
The Shah-i-Zinda Ensemble is a collection of mausoleums and sacred buildings dating back to the 11th through 15th centuries, with some additions in the 19th century. Its name, “Shah-i-Zinda,” meaning “The living king,” is linked to the legend of Qutham ibn Abbas, a cousin of Prophet Muhammad, believed to be interred here. Qutham ibn Abbas arrived in Samarkand during the 7th century Arab invasion to spread the teachings of Islam.

The ensemble, evolving over eight centuries, now encompasses more than twenty structures. It comprises three sections—lower, middle, and upper—connected by four-arched domed passages known as chartak. The earliest buildings date to the 11th and 12th centuries, with most dating from the 14th and 15th centuries. While later reconstructions from the 16th to 19th centuries occurred, they didn’t alter the fundamental layout or appearance significantly.

The primary structure, the Kusam-ibn-Abbas complex, lies in the northeast part and includes the Kusam-ibn-Abbas mausoleum and mosque, dating to the 16th century. The upper group comprises three mausoleums facing each other, including the Khodja-Akhmad Mausoleum (1340s) and the Mausoleum of 1361.

The middle group features mausoleums from the late 14th to early 15th centuries, associated with Timur’s relatives and aristocracy. Notable structures include the Turkan Ago Mausoleum and the Mausoleum of Shirin Bika Aga.

Among the lower group buildings is the double-cupola mausoleum dedicated to Kazi Zade Rumi, a scientist and astronomer. Constructed by Ulugh Beg in 1434 to 1435, it stands out for its proportional design. The ensemble’s main entrance gate, known as Darvazakhana, faces south and was erected under Ulugh Beg in 1434 to 1435.

The Shah-i-Zinda Ensemble stands as a testament to centuries of architectural and cultural evolution, reflecting the religious and historical significance of the region.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Лазурные усыпальницы Самарканда.💙

Узбекистан — не самая первая страна, которая приходит на ум, когда выбираешь, куда поехать в путешествие. И когда мы ее посетили, то остались в полном восторге. Особенно, после Самарканда.

Древнейший город покорил нас своей архитектурой, колоритом, открытыми и доброжелательными местными жителями. А если взять определеную локацию, то - комплекс мавзолеев Шахи Зинда.

Выглядит этот некрополь невероятно красиво: изящные, расписанные голубыми красками и орнаментами, с лазурными куполами усыпальницы вереницей тянутся вдоль узкой улочки. И точно заслужил свое место в сердечке.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Hands down it’s one of the most spectacular sites that you will get to see, not just in Samarkand, but in the whole world. It’s one of those places that will remain in your memory for life. A definite must see for anyone visiting Samarkand.

The Shah-i-Zinda Ensemble includes mausoleums and other ritual buildings of 11th – 15th and 19th centuries. The name Shah-i-Zinda (meaning "The living king") is connected with the legend that Qutham ibn Abbas, a cousin of Muhammad, is buried here. He came to Samarkand with the Arab invasion in the 7th century to preach Islam.

The Shah-i-Zinda complex was formed over eight (from the 11th until the 19th) centuries and now includes more than twenty buildings

text: The site is the equivalent of Rome's Pantheon or Krakow's Wawel. Extraordinary architecture. I still dream about the colourful mosaics. Lots of tourists, so it's worth coming in the morning. For example, plaques could be placed behind the mausoleums.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
乌兹别克斯坦撒马尔罕：夏伊•辛达陵墓群Shah-i-Zinda
门票：40000苏姆
夏伊•辛达陵墓群始建于14-15世纪的，即帖木儿时期。
该建筑群的名字来源于先知穆罕默德的侄子库萨姆•本•阿巴斯。
夏伊•辛达，意为“永生之王”，“活着的国王”。
这里主要是安葬帖木尔大帝亲眷和贵族的陵墓群，以及帖木儿大帝及其孙子兀鲁伯的一些妃子和宠臣。
这里由无数的蓝色瓷砖点缀，繁复的花纹图案，黄色的砖块，每一个小房间都放置着以前的重要人物石棺，每一个房间都精雕细琢、石刻、嵌瓷、穹顶各有不同，建筑之精美，在断壁残垣中也能窥见曾经的璀璨辉煌….

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Shohizinda — Samarqanddagi meʼmoriy yodgorlik (11—19-asrlar); Afrosiyob tepaligi jan.da joylashgan qabristondagi maqbaralardan hamda masjid, minora va madrasadan iborat ansambl.

Shohizinda meʼmoriy majmuasi Qoraxoniylar sulolasi tomonidan asos solingan.

Ularning eng qadimiysi Qusam ibn Abbos maqbarasi boʻlib, xalq orasida Shohizinda (tirik shoh) nomi bilan mashhur. Ansambl bir-biri bilan yoʻlak orqali bogʻlangan 3 guruh binolardan iborat. Quyi guruhdagi inshootlar Ulugʻbek oʻgʻli nomidan qurdirgan Abdulaziz chortogʻi (1434—35), unga shim.dan Davlat qushbegi madrasasi (1812—13) tutash, uning qarshisidagi ayvonli masjid naqshlar bilan nafis bezatilgan. 40 bosqichli tik zinapoya oʻrtaligʻining chap tomonida ziyoratxona va goʻrxonadan iborat qoʻshgumbazli maqbara (15-asr) joylashgan.

Oʻrta guruhdagi binolar: Amirzoda maqbarasi, Tugʻlu Tekin maqbarasi, Shirinbeka ogʻo maqbarasi, uning qarshisida Temurning boshqa singlisi Turkan ogʻo maqbarasi, 8 qirrali maqbara, Ali Nasafiy maqbarasi kabilar.

Yuqori guruhdagi binolar: Ziyoratxona, uch qismdan iborat masjid, Xoja Ahmad maqbarasi, 1360—61 yillarda qurilgan maqbara, Tuman ogʻo majmuasi (1405—06), 2 ta nomsiz maqbara (14asr oxiri)ning kiraverish devorigina saqlangan. Shuningdek, Tamgʻoch Bugʻroxon madrasasi (11-asr), Amir Burunduq maqbarasi (14-asr oxiri) kabilardir. Ansambl tarkibidagi 20 dan ortiq inshootlar davlat muhofazasiga olingan. 19—20-asrlarda ansamblning yana bir necha binolari barpo etilgan. 18-asrda vayron boʻlgan zina oʻrnida 40 pogʻonali gʻishtin yangi zina qurilgan. Oʻzbekiston Respublikasi Vazirlar Mahkamasining 2004-yil 16-iyul qaroriga asosan Sh. yodgorlik majmuasida katta koʻlamdagi taʼmirlash va obodonlashtirish ishlari amalga oshirildi.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: Shakhi Zinda is the burial place of royal persons and nobles. But the main mausoleum from which the necropolis starts seems to be the imaginary grave of Prophet Muhammad's cousin, Kusam ibn Abbas. The complex was called "Shakhi Zinda" that means in Persian "The Living King". He was one of those who preached Islam in that region. Later the Complex became an important pilgrimage centre that was revered by the people as sacred.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Shahi Zinda, Uzbekistan 🇺🇿Oct 23
Embark on a journey through time in the heart of Samarkand, Uzbekistan! Shahi Zinda, meaning "Living King," is more than an ancient necropolis; it's a mesmerizing blend of history, architecture, and spirituality along the Silk Road.
Wander through narrow alleyways adorned with vibrant tiles, each telling the tale of Central Asia's nobility and royalty. The Persian and Timurid architecture at Shahi Zinda showcases intricate geometric patterns, floral motifs, and historical inscriptions, a testament to the dedication of the artisans who shaped this enchanting complex.

Ascend the stairway to the stars for panoramic views of Samarkand, where the azure tiles create a magical atmosphere, especially during sunrise or sunset. Don't forget to capture the essence of this timeless place with your camera and absorb the tranquility that fills the air.
Extend your exploration beyond Shahi Zinda to discover the flavors and traditions of Samarkand. Sample the rich spices of local cuisine and engage with the warm hospitality of the Uzbek people. The bustling Siab Bazaar offers a vibrant glimpse into daily life and regional traditions.
A visit to Shahi Zinda is a pilgrimage through time, where the past whispers its tales to those willing to listen. Explore this enchanting site and let the echoes of history guide you through the captivating beauty of Samarkand's Shahi Zinda.
Thanks and Regards.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: Это памятный комплекс который состоит из 11 мавзолеев, построенных в 14-15 веках нашей эры, т.е во времена Тимура. Включён в Список Всемирного  наследия Юнеско. Считается одним из самых посещаемых мазаров (мавзолей) Средней Азии. Здесь многолюдно и вполне можно встретить таких людей как президента Италии (см.фото).

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
The Shah-i-Zinda Ensemble
Shah-i-Zinda or Shohizinda is a necropolis in Samarkand. It has mausoleums of important people from 11th to 19th century CE. Shahizinda means ‘living king’. It is called so because of a cousin of prophet Muhammed who is buried here in the complex. Shah-i-Zinda is located in the north east direction from the Registan square. The distance is comfortably walkable. In fact I walked the distance starting at the Gur-e-Amir through Registan, Presidents memorial, Bibi Khanym, the Presidents mausoleum, and  finally to Shahizinda. The distance involved is about 6 kilometres and entirely enjoyable because of the historical attractions which one goes on exploring.

A wonderful and memorable experience indeed.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Отличное историческое место в Самарканде.
Шахи-Зинда — единственный в Самарканде археолого-архитектурный памятник, в котором, включая культурные напластования Афрасиаба.
Большинство построек относятся к эпохе Тимуридов (XIV—XV вв.), а перестройки нашего времени практически не повлияли на композицию и внешний вид комплекса. Мавзолеи имеют бирюзовую отделку или покрыты темно-синей плиткой с цветочными орнаментами.
У каждого мавзолея свой неповторимый стиль.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: Sicuramente tra i monumenti più belli di tutto l’Uzbekistan!! È un complesso monumentale molto ricco e piano di dettagli che tolgono il fiato. Qui sono sepolti molti personaggi storici legati alla storia del paese. Per entrare si deve percorrere una scalinata ed è tradizione che ogni persona conti il numero dei gradini, esprima un desiderio e uscendo conti nuovamente i gradini; se il numero coincide entrambe le volte il desiderio si avvererà! Luogo fantastico specialmente per i fotografi e chi vuole pubblicare storie sui social. È un sito abbastanza affollato quindi bisogna avere un po’ di pazienza. È consigliato anche visitarlo con una guida per avere i dettagli storici e capire di più l’importanza di questa necropoli. Direi che la visita dura circa due ore perché vi verrà voglia di scattare una infinità di foto o comunque concentrarvi su i tanti dettagli architettonici.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: Our final stop on the day's tour - and by now we were all getting rather jaded - was the Shahi Zinda Mausoleum complex.  Built in the fifteenth century around the alleged grave of the Prophet's cousin.  It was a steep climb with a necropolis on the lower slopes and then mausoleums on the top of the hill.  Some - such as the ones to Timur's wives or daughters - were beautiful and others were far plainer, often with an unknown person or family interred inside.  By now it was the case of more amazing mosaics, more beautiful blue domes, more gorgeous calligraphy!  This was also the busiest attraction we visited in the city, or seemed it as it was quite a narrow walk between the buildings and up the hill.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Очень красивое место, хотя по факту - это просто улица на кладбище, ведь этот комплекс состоит из мавзолеев, а мавзолей - это мы же знаем, что такое)
Думаю, что вечером вид будет чуть хуже, чем в солнечную погоду, ведь именно на солнце очень красиво переливаются лазурным цветом порталы мавзолеев. Внутри этих усыпальниц так же есть довольно красивые убранства. В некоторых воспроизведены исторические события.
Естественно данное место я рекомендую к посещению, хоть и довольно много туристов, и местами создается толкучка.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: Il cimitero del periodo timuride è lo Shah-i-Zinda, costruito dopo la morte di Amir Timur verso il 1420. Ospita, oltre a quella di Tamerlano, le tombe dei parenti dei discendenti del condottiero quasi tutte donne. La maggior parte dei manufatti rispecchia essenzialmenre l'arte del tempo con portali a ogiva piastrellati di maioliche di colore blu, bianco e verde.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: Shah-i Zinda es un lugar imprescindible si se visita Uzbekistán. Nosotros lo llamamos el pasillo de los mausoleos y su espectacularidad deja a uno sin palabras. Se accede por unas escaleras que dan paso a un pequeño arco que no te augura la maravilla que espera al otro lado. Es recomendable ir temprano para disfrutarlo con pocos turistas y dedicarle al menos una hora para disfrutarlo sosegadamente. Si proyectas viajar a Uzbekistan es seguro que visitarás Samarcanda. Que en ningun caso, el plan de viaje prescinda de esta joya. Para mi y mi pareja, lo mejor de lo mejor y uno de los lugares más mágicos que conocemos.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis

レギスタン広場より映える。

特に混雑はしておらず、チケットはその場で買っていい。

他観光地同様、中にはお土産物屋が数店舗あるが、外国人向け価格とはいえ大した値段はしないので、気に入ったものがあれば買うべき。

💙💙💙 This necropolis complex is spectacular, for me as striking as Registan but I hadn't known this until researching more about Samarkand and places to visit.

Set atop a hill, it was a manageable walk from my guest house (lots of simple roads, not amazing condition) and just WOW!

At the entrance by the ticket office they do provide clothing to cover up.

Very busy even in the morning and a lot of tourists posing for "insteagrammable" style pics - but have to be respectful.

The tombs and mausoleums are so beautiful and you can see them all lined up in one

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Conocida coloquialmente como "la calle de los mausoleos, comprende más de veinte edificios construidos entre el siglo XI y el siglo XIX.
Su nombre significa "el rey viviente" y hace referencia a la leyenda de que aquí está enterrado el primo de Mahoma, que fue decapitado por predicar el Islam, pero no murió y, recogiendo su cabeza, fue por su propio pie al jardín del Edén.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: No one can rate this wonderful monument less than 5* . The history date backs to 14th 15th century and there are mud shaped structures which had some use no one knows. Many mausoleums dates back to 12th century which are still unknown. The monument is based in the memory of shahi Zinda King who was the cousin of prophet Mohammad (an Islamic God like believed) and the architect is way beyond expectations. It even has an octagonal shaped mausoleum. The visitor has so many questions after seeing this, but no one has the answer. And some thing must never be known they are ‘Unknowns’ it teaches us we should not run after answers for everything whats happening. Sometimes even Unknown is considered as Known. Great!!! Price for a foreign tourist is 40K UZBEKI SOM.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text: An unforgettable experience walking amidst the spirits of Uzbekistan’s royalties.  The mausoleum is well-restored and we were simply blown away by its colours. A few points to note - there are many stories about this site that you will not learn on your own and for such a significant site it is recommended to get a local tour guide who can tell you the stories in your language. We didn’t do that, to my regret. Secondly, either go super early or wait till the early dusk hours, those are the times when you can enjoy the sites without the hassles of fighting over photo take spots with others. It is a very popular place indeed. Allow for at least two hours there.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Пожалуй, этот комплекс впечатлил больше всех остальных! Он очень красочный, с узкими улочками. Туристов прилично, но если приехать раньше или под закрытие, то можно сделать очень красивые фото. С гидом в разы интереснее. Часть комплекса реставрирована, но в большинстве своём он в первозданном виде. Помещения мавзолеев маленькие, но один краше другого. Мозайка, майолика, плитка просто потрясающие! Про лестницу, ведущую наверх есть легенда, что нужно загадать желание и считать ступени туда и обратно. Если совпадёт, то исполниться) однозначно рекомендую. Есть парковка принимают карты.
-----
Perhaps this complex impressed more than anyone else!  It is very colorful, with narrow streets. There are decently tourists, but if you arrive earlier or before closing, you can take very beautiful photos. It's much more interesting with a guide. Part of the complex has been restored, but for the most part it is in its original form. The rooms of the mausoleums are small, but one is more beautiful than the other.  Mosaic, majolica, tiles are just amazing! There is a legend about the stairs leading up that you need to make a wish and count the steps back and forth. If it matches, then it will come true) I definitely recommend it. There is a parking lot that accepts cards.

Şah-ı Zinde; diğer adıyla Kusem b. Abbas:

Hz. Peygamber’in amcazadesi,
Kendisine en fazla benzeyen kişi,
Hatta o geldiğinde Peygamber Efendimiz geliyor hissi uyandıracak kadar benzeyen akrabası,

Hz. Peygamberi kabre koyan, hatta kabirden en son çıkan şanslı kişi…
Ve İslamiyet’in Semerkand civarına kadar ulaşıp yerleşmesi için hayatını feda eden yüksek ideal sahibi samimi bir müslüman …

Kendisini Semerkand’a emanet eden, yüzyıllardır bu şehre şeref saçan büyük sahabe …

Bir şehir için bundan büyük bir hediye olabilir mi,

Komşusu olan ve birbirinden değerli çini ve hat örnekleri ile bezeli türbeler arasında sade görünümüyle de adeta ders vermeye devam eden mütevazı bir değerimiz …

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
Blue #shahizinda .🇺🇿

Monumental Necropolis of Shah-i-Zinda in Samarkand, Uzbekistan

Özbekistan'ın en güzide şehirlerinden biri.
Tarihi yerleri, el sanatı, Özbek pilavi, tandir çörekleri ve altın dişleriyle gülümseyen insanları çok ilgi çekici.

Özbekistan'da akla ilk gelen kent Semerkant, geçmişi çok eskiye, 2500 yıl önceye dayanan bir şehir. Bazı büyük imparatorluklara başkent olduğu gibi, tarihin en büyük imparatorları bu şehre ayak basmış. Büyük İskender, İsmail Samani, Sultan Sencer, Cengiz Han, Amir Timur, Babür Han)

Şah-ı Zinde Külliyesi, ziyaretçilerin en önemli uğrak yerleri arasında. Külliye'de Timur'un soyundan gelen şehzadelerin mezarları bulunuyor. Külliye adını Hazreti Muhammed'in yeğeni Kusam bin Abbas'tan alıyor. Shah-i Zinda ismi "yaşayan kral" anlamına gelir.

Her hükümdar bölgeye bir eser yaptırmayı kendisi için bir şeref olarak görmüş. Külliye'nin duvarları ayet ve hadisler ile süslü.

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
text:
ここを初めて訪れたのは2009年だった。
当時はパックツアーに参加して自由時間に案内してもらった。
お墓と聞かないとわからないような壮麗な美しさ。当時の王侯の絶大な権力を感じた。
そして2022年夏に個人で再訪した。
コロナで観光客が少ないとはいえ観光地のヴァカンスシーズン。
狭い通りは賑わっていた。
少し寂しげな感じが似合う場所だから、残念かなと感じた。

title: Shah-i-Zinda necropolis
